thread.title: Credit Suisse fourth-quarter net loss $2.34 billion; to cut 5,500 jobs
thread.title_full: Credit Suisse fourth-quarter net loss $2.34 billion; to cut 5,500 jobs

title: Credit Suisse fourth-quarter net loss $2.34 billion; to cut 5,500 jobs
text:
41am EST Credit Suisse fourth-quarter net loss $2.34 billion; to cut 5,500 jobs A man enters the Credit Suisse offices in the Manhattan borough of New York City, U.S. July 5, 2016. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid 
ZURICH Credit Suisse ( CSGN.S ) on Tuesday posted a 2.35 billion Swiss franc ($2.34 billion) net loss for the fourth quarter on the back of a U.S. legal settlement, and said it will cut its headcount further in 2017 by a net 5,500 jobs. 
The average estimate in a Reuters poll of seven analysts was for a net loss of 2.013 billion francs in the quarter. 
For 2016, Switzerland's second-biggest bank posted a net loss of 2.44 billion francs following a 2.94 billion franc loss in 2015. 
Nevertheless, Credit Suisse proposed a dividend of 0.70 francs per share, in line with market expectations. 
(Reporting by Joshua Franklin;
